synopsis: In episode #6 of Pineapple Blood Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir dive deep into the intricate relationship between self-worth and neuroticism. They share personal experiences and insights, exploring how understanding oneself and processing emotions can lead to greater freedom and connection with others.
quotes: The emptiness in myself was like a hole where my self-worth should have been.
It's so much better to finally get a grasp on the problems that scare you.
You can stop blaming yourself and start working on actually dealing with things.
I feel like I changed more in the last few months than I have in literally years.
You have to trust the people around you; nobody has ill intentions.
It's okay to not fit in every place; you're unique.
You can't ever truly be altruistic unless you're egoistic to a certain extent.
Being able to lend other people kindness and understanding helps us become compassionate towards ourselves.
You have to give yourself time; growth takes time.
Sometimes, just existing without thinking is the most liberating experience.
